question.title: Unmarshal an object from XML file
question.body:
I am trying to unmarshal an XML into an object.



<ERT>
    <id_car_PT>123</id_car_PT>          
    <obj1>
        <reg_car>ABC123</reg_car>       
    </obj1>
    <obj2>
        <id_car_PT>456</id_car_PT>      
    </obj2>
</ERT>

The main object has a variable id_car_PT, and two nested objects: obj1 and obj2. Both of these nested objects have variables with the same names as in the XML.

When I unmarshal this XML into my object structure, the values of id_car_PT are not being loaded — neither the one in the root nor the one inside obj2. However, the variable reg_car is loaded correctly from obj1.

Why is this happening? Environment: Castor 0.9.5.4 Java 7

I tried changing the name multiple times — using hyphens, uppercase letters, and other combinations — but it didn’t work.

Example

public class ERT {
    private String id_car_PT;
    private Obj1 obj1;
    private Obj2 obj2;

    public String getId_car_PT() {
        return id_car_PT;
    }

    public void setId_car_PT(String id_car_PT) {
        this.id_car_PT = id_car_PT;
    }

    public Obj1 getObj1() {
        return obj1;
    }

    public void setObj1(Obj1 obj1) {
        this.obj1 = obj1;
    }

    public Obj2 getObj2() {
        return obj2;
    }

    public void setObj2(Obj2 obj2) {
        this.obj2 = obj2;
    }
}

public class Obj1 {
    private String reg_car;

    public String getReg_car() {
        return reg_car;
    }

    public void setReg_car(String reg_car) {
        this.reg_car = reg_car;
    }
}

public class Obj2 {
    private String id_car_PT;

    public String getId_car_PT() {
        return id_car_PT;
    }

    public void setId_car_PT(String id_car_PT) {
        this.id_car_PT = id_car_PT;
    }
}

import org.exolab.castor.xml.Unmarshaller;
import java.io.StringReader;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            String xml = "<ERT><id_car_PT>123</id_car_PT><obj1><reg_car>ABC123</reg_car></obj1><obj2><id_car_PT>456</id_car_PT></obj2></ERT>";
            StringReader reader = new StringReader(xml);

            Unmarshaller unmarshaller = new Unmarshaller(ERT.class);
            ERT ert = (ERT) unmarshaller.unmarshal(reader);

            System.out.println(ert.getId_car_PT());
            System.out.println(ert.getObj1().getReg_car());
            System.out.println(ert.getObj2().getId_car_PT());

        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

Result:

null
ABC123
null

answers.body:
I've modified your example to have a try, my example is like this:

ERT.java:

public class ERT {
    private String id_car_PT;
    private String idAinioPt;
    private Obj1 obj1;
    private Obj2 obj2;

    public Obj1 getObj1() {
        return obj1;
    }

    public void setObj1(Obj1 obj1) {
        this.obj1 = obj1;
    }

    public Obj2 getObj2() {
        return obj2;
    }

    public void setObj2(Obj2 obj2) {
        this.obj2 = obj2;
    }

    public String getIdAinioPt() {
        return idAinioPt;
    }

    public void setIdAinioPt(String idAinioPt) {
        this.idAinioPt = idAinioPt;
    }

    public String getId_car_PT() {
        return id_car_PT;
    }

    public void setId_car_PT(String id_car_PT) {
        this.id_car_PT = id_car_PT;
    }
}

Obj1.java:

public class Obj1 {
    private String reg_car;

    public String getReg_car() {
        return reg_car;
    }

    public void setReg_car(String reg_car) {
        this.reg_car = reg_car;
    }
}

Obj2.java:

public class Obj2 {
    private String id_car_pt;

    public String getId_car_pt() {
        return id_car_pt;
    }

    public void setId_car_pt(String id_car_pt) {
        this.id_car_pt = id_car_pt;
    }
}

Main.java:

import org.exolab.castor.xml.Unmarshaller;
import java.io.StringReader;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            String xml = "<ERT><id_car_-pT>123</id_car_-pT><id-ainio-pt>3223</id-ainio-pt><obj1><reg_car>ABC123</reg_car></obj1><obj2><id_car_pt>456</id_car_pt></obj2></ERT>";
            StringReader reader = new StringReader(xml);

            Unmarshaller unmarshaller = new Unmarshaller(ERT.class);
            ERT ert = (ERT) unmarshaller.unmarshal(reader);

            System.out.println(ert.getId_car_PT());
            System.out.println(ert.getIdAinioPt());
            System.out.println(ert.getObj1().getReg_car());
            System.out.println(ert.getObj2().getId_car_pt());

        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

It can print:

123
3223
ABC123
456

Camel-case named member variables in Java should be lower case and connected with - in XML document.

You can learn more from Caster Official.
